text: Hi all is there anybody who pass HubSpot developer track exam ?
<@UEYV6TEAU> I did, passed the practicum too
is there a way to print `{{ content.post_body }}` with `no_wrapper=True`? It’s currently printing elements in a span tag
<@U3T21PDBK> if you are getting wrappers are you sure those arent in the content itself?

You could filter `content.post_body|replace('<span id="hs_cos_wrapper_post_body" class="hs_cos_wrapper hs_cos_wrapper_meta_field hs_cos_wrapper_type_rich_text" style="" data-hs-cos-general-type="meta_field" data-hs-cos-type="rich_text">', '')`. You wouldn't be able to filter the closing tag without also breaking any spans that might be in the post body, but I don't think that'll affect anything meaningful

Quick modules question. When updating an existing module with dependents, if you update the name of a field, will the existing instances of the module maintain the data tied to that field (based on something like a field ID)?
